Return Kaplan-Meier (K-M) curves from a PHS model

km_curve.Rd

km_curve() is a generic function that calculates Kaplan-Meier survival curves from a coxph fit or directly from a data.frame. It returns a data.frame with time, survival estimates, and upper/lower confidence intervals.

Usage

km_curve(object, ...)

# S3 method for class 'data.frame'
km_curve(
  object,
  phs = "phs",
  age = "age",
  status = "status",
  interval = c(0, 1),
  age_range = 40:100,
  scale = FALSE,
  inverse = FALSE,
  ...
)

# S3 method for class 'phsfit'
km_curve(
  object,
  phs = "phs",
  age = "age",
  status = "status",
  interval = c(0, 1),
  age_range = 40:100,
  scale = FALSE,
  inverse = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

object

An object for which a KM curve is desired. For method details, see the specific method.

...

Additional arguments (currently ignored)

phs

String specifying the column name in data containing the polygenic hazard score. Default "phs".

age

String specifying the column name in data containing the age of each subject. Default "age".

status

String specifying the column name in data containing case/control status (0 = censored, 1 = event). Default "status".

interval

Vector of length 2 giving lower and upper quantiles of PHS to define the interval. By default includes all PHSes: c(0, 1).

age_range

Vector of ages over which curves should be calculated. Default 40:100.

scale

Logical; if TRUE, centers and scales PHS to unit variance. Default FALSE.

inverse

Logical; if TRUE, reverses PHS direction. Default FALSE.

Value

A data.frame with columns time, estimate, conf.low, conf.high, and cumhaz.

Examples

phsfit <- fit_phs(test_data)
km_df <- km_curve(phsfit)

# data.frame interface
km_df2 <- km_curve(test_data)

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(km_df, aes(x = time, y = estimate, ymin = conf.low, ymax = conf.high)) +
  geom_ribbon() +
  geom_step()
} # }
